description: From Latin promeritus, past participle of promerere (“to deserve”), from pro (“before”) + merere (“to merit”).

verbs.description: promerit (third-person singular simple present promerits, present participle promeriting, simple past and past participle promerited)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To oblige; to confer a favour on.
examples: O God, while thou dost thus promerit us by thy Providence, let us not wrong thee by distrust

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To deserve; to procure by merit.
examples: Beneficence and communication do not forget, for with such hostes God is promerited.
